intro: Swainsona stipularis, commonly known as the yellow trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling trumpets, and its rapid growth habit. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces long, slender seed pods that split open when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Swainsona stipularis is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
